snippet: Increasingly, Internet companies like Microsoft, Facebook and Mozilla are pushing each other to prove to consumers that their data is safe and in their control.
abstract: Internet companies like Microsoft, Facebook and Mozilla are trying to gain market advantage by casting themselves as more privacy-friendly than their competitors, while also requiring increased privacy standards from companies they work with; trend follows increased customer awareness and threat of stricter regulations.
lead_paragraph: Increasingly, Internet companies like Microsoft, Facebook and Mozilla are pushing each other to prove to consumers that their data is safe and in their control.

headline.seo: As ‘Do Not Track’ Effort Seems to Stall, Web Companies Race to Look Privacy-Friendly
headline.main: Web Privacy Becomes a Business Imperative
headline.print_headline: Web Privacy Becomes A Business Imperative
